result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon D Spaeth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties and surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge. Bail to apply.  Balance to be paid by collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Exended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Progam and the Substance Abuse program only after serving  the first year of this sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Obtain mental health assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Take any prescribed medication only in the manner as prescribed by a treating physician.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users, dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in cognitive thinking program and/or anger management.  Agent to determine which program, or if both are necessary.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment. Successfully complete folow up treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

records.addlTxt: Decisio and Order Denying Request to Modify CIP/WSAP terms signed and filed.  Copy sent to Defendant and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to modify ERP eligibility.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING - VOLUME II  (27 pages) commencing JUNE 26, 2014 received and filed.
Original Transcript PLEA & SENTENCING - VOLUME I  (48 pages) commencing  JUNE 25, 2014 received and filed.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Brandon D Spaeth in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Brandon D Spaeth in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea and Sentencing.  Hearing proceeded.   Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the state, defense, Lori S., and defendant.  Due to the lateness of the hour (4:52 p.m.) the court continues this case to 6-26-14 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing.
Copy of PSI from Washington County, filed by defense.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Brandon D Spaeth not in court, in custody(prison).  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.

Defendant Brandon D Spaeth in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Brandon D Spaeth in custody.  Step Nolten for Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon D Spaeth in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Brandon D Spaeth in custody.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
